characters: NUMBER OF VEHICLES, LEAD VEHICLE, PERSONNEL PER VEHICLE,
NUMBER OF ARRESTING AGENTS, LEAD AGENT...
I NEED TO KNOW IF I CAN TRUST YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get a look at the Department of Justice at night. Then Capitol, rising majestically. RACK BACK to the FBI HQ... Eric emerges, looking dwarfed by this mammoth building.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Eric mounts the steps of the Music Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drifts down a hallway. On either side of him, we hear PIANOS being played in PRACTICE ROOMS. 20 pieces at once. He stops outside a door, recognizing the playing within. smile fans across his face. He peeks through a tiny windo Sure enough, Juliana is inside, practicing in this tiny r She doesn't see him. He reaches for the door. Then his CEL-PHONE RINGS. Shit. An instinct tells him to throw the damn thing into a tras can. All he wants is on the other side of this door... Instead, he answers the phone:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: This is Eric.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (THRU CEL)
dialogues.text: How fast can you get to the Field office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevator doors open... and here's Kate, awaiting us:  81.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He goes to the D.I.A. tomorrow at 10 a.m. Is that right? So much for hello. Eric freezes in place.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You're driving him? ERIC. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Follow me. She moves away. Eric hurries out of the elevator. We foll

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got about five minutes; case is ratcheting up and the Director needs to be briefed on it.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: What was on the Palm Pilot?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Everything. We TRACK THEM through the 5th floor of the W.F.O. It's em

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The arrogant son of a bitch actually kept a record of all of his correspondence with the KGB, GRU, and SVR. Last drop was two months ago.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: So he's active...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Very much so. (they keep walking) Most of the datacard is still encrypted. First thing we cracked was a ledger tracing payments-received: six-hundred thousand in cash so far, with another eight hundred thousand waiting for him in an escrow account in Moscow.  82. Just then, Eric stops - at a LARGE CONFERENCE ROOM. It's PACKED. 60 AGENTS now, grinding away.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Bigot-list just got a little bigger.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We're starting air surveillance, picket surveillance, monitoring his phones and computers. We'll also be buying the house across the street from him and putting two agents there. (soberly: ) As long as he's active, every single source we're working has to be considered at risk: Counter-Intel and Counter-Terrorism. He knows all their names and locations. (Eric nods) Okay. Tomorrow. You'll drive him in a Bureau vehicle. Make sure you keep him out of the office for at least three hours. We're sweeping his car.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Need to get some hard evidence on him. Thanks for--

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Ya know, he doesn't think you're close.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: We walked by the SIOC once; he knew there was a molehunt going on in there. But he thought you were targeting CIA Officers only. Sorta treated the whole thing like a joke.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: +.-unless he was just working you, to see if you knew any better. (Eric considers that) Three hours.  131 83. With that, she ducks behind the door. Eric stares at it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness, just that desk-lamp on. We PAN along the attic floor, following electrical wires that lead us to Hanssen printer, tv, lap-top. ...until we find Hanssen himself, at his desk, his back turned to us, holding a CORDLESS PHONE. Sitting, conflicted... until he dials a number, and:

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Victor? Bob Hanssen... Fine, fine. How are you? We MOVE IN on him now, slowly - his face still hidden to

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (PHONE, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a proposal for you, Victor... Yes, I think I've seized upon a sure- fire way to put you into business with the Bureau, to get a contract out of them for Invicta's technology. (pauses, then:) Hire me as a consultant. We see a quarter of his face now - just enough to know ho much he hates having to pitch himself. But...

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (PHONE, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one understands your systems like I do, no one can be a more effective advocate for them. And I don't think I have to tell you how much influence I have in terms of I.T. and case- management-security around there. These guys are at sea without my input, and they know it. He laughs, a bit forced. CAMERA SETTLES on his profile...

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (PHONE, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My timetable? Well, that would be now actually. (trying to sound breezy) Yes, I wanna get out of there before my fellow Agents start inflicting a bunch of farewell parties on me. Another forced laugh... then he tightens - just heard a polite version of "No, Thanks."  132 133 134

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (PHONE, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see. Well... Suddenly he's become Willy Loman; it sickens him...

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (PHONE, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I suppose I should have been more precise, Victor. I'm not looking for a rich deal. And whatever you paid me would be more than offset by the monies I'd be bringing through the door. It's a very lucrative contract I'd be securing for you. (a beat...) Will you? Good. That's all I ask. I know the logic of it will appeal to you if you consider it long enough. (it's dead, he knows it) Thank you for your time, Victor. I apologize for having bothered you at home... Good night. He hangs up the phone and shuts his eyes, fighting a feel of despair. On his face we MATCH DISSOLVE TO: ..-Hanssen, in the passenger seat of a CHEVY SUBURBAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a brilliant, sunlit morning. Eric, in the driver's s shows his I.D. to a GUARD at a MILITARY GUARD-POST. The Suburban is waved through. Then it disappears into th garage of this modern, non-descript building in Roslyn, V

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanssen and Eric enter a windowless marble lobby. THREE separate security checks here, manned by MILITARY PERSONN

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. FBI HQ
dialogues.text: We're two levels down. Hanssen's Taurus is driven past us an UNSEEN DRIVER, who parks it behind a CEMENT BARRICADE. Waiting at the barricade is a FED-EX truck. A SWEEP TEAM emerges from it, each agent wearing inspection gloves. They look toward Special Agent DAN PLESAC. He's 47, wiry.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: We've got until noon.  135 136 137 85. The Sweep Team decends on the Taurus.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. D.I-A.
dialogues.text: Eric and Hanssen stand in 4 DATA CENTER that puts the FBI Data Center to shame. SEVEN SUPERCOMPUTERS down here, eac identical, churning out data. Immaculate, impressive.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: The Seven Dwarfs, watching the world. (Eric smiles thinly) God I wish the Bureau had this kind of technology: In bg we see a Guy IN A SUIT, talking on @ telephone. Eri eyes him. CONTINUE INTERCUT: INT. FBI HQ — GARAGE - RESUMING 136 pHoTos of ever inch of the Taurus and its interior now £1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a bulletin poard. Plesac eyes them, then nods to a TRUNK CATALOGUER and an ENGINE CATALOGUER: "proceed."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open the trunk and hood of the Taurus, but:

dialogues.speaker: TRUNK CATALOGUER
dialogues.text: Jesus. Plesac turns to see what the TRUNK CATALOGUER is seeing: Hanssen's ARMORY: the 9 mm., the sub-machine gun, the 400 rounds of ammunition, and all of it under clear PLASTIC.

dialogues.speaker: . TRUNK CATALOGUER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This guy could park at the bottom of the Potomac and come out firing. Plesac nods soberly. CONTINUE INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That SUIT hangs approaches Hanssen, a bit sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: D.1.A. SUIT
dialogues.text: Got some bad news, Agent Hanssen: we're gonna hafta cut this meeting short.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Phat D.I.A. SUIT at was my superior, callin i h g me into an emergency meeting. I’m sorry.  138 139 86.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Does he know that I'm here? Does he know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: D.I.A. SUIT
dialogues.text: I made all that clear to him, Sir, yes. He asked me to reschedule at your convenience.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: No thanks. Without warning, Hanssen turns to go. Eric's eyes go wide

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: This visit was a courtesy. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sir, maybe there's someone else who can show us around.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Get the fucking car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE PLASTIC TARP has been laid out. Sitting on it are Taurus' HOOD, doors, tires, every inch of its CARPETING. Also on the tarp: two HEADSHOTS of Catherine Zeta-Jones.. and DVD's of "Entrapment" and "The Mask of Zorro." That's odd. We also find Hanssen's guns and ammo. .»..and a box of LAWN & LEAF BAGS, some WHITE MEDICAL TAP BOX OF COLORED CHALK. Most importantly, the sealed lawn & leaf bag that Hanssen filled in his Attic. Hard evidence. Plesac nods to an EVIDENCE PHOTOGRAPHER, go.to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric pulls up in the Chevy. Hanssen gets in, slams the do

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Boss, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: I was doing you a favor, bringing you along.  140 141 142 87.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I spoke out of turn. I know that.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: When somebody takes a shit on you, you don't reschedule. He wasn't called into any meeting. That was a power play.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I didn't...I didn't read it that way.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: That's why you're still a clerk. Just take me back to the office. Eric knows he can't do that... CONTINUE INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Evidence Photographer clicks away as Plesac stands stoically. Then his CEL-PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: Plesac.

dialogues.speaker: GEDDES, (THRU CEL)
dialogues.text: They're on their way back.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. SURVEILLING SEDAN
dialogues.text: Geddes and Brooks, Eric's old team, drive ina plain sedan tailing the Suburban along Wilson Boulevard in Arlington,

dialogues.speaker: GEDDES, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: The meeting took 20 minutes. They're on Wilson Boulevard, heading back. Plesac looks at the pieces of that dismembered Taurus: do bumpers, engine parts, carpeting. A mess...

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Good God.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. THE SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: Eric looks in his rear-view mirror, very much aware that being tailed. Beside him, Hanssen fumes.  143 144 88.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Would you like to hear some music, Six?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm in the mood for some Andrews Sisters. They got any in here?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Not to my knowledge, Sir..

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Didn't think so. Silence... then Eric's PAGER BUZZES. Eric grabs it. The f reads 7#. Hanssen eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She certainly does like to know where you are, doesn't she? Eric smiles anxiously. CONTINUE INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plesac snaps his cel-phone shut, turns to his Sweep Team:

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Sew it up.

dialogues.speaker: TRUNK CATALOGUER
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: We're aborting. Sew it up.

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING 144
dialogues.text: Eric drives. Hanssen clicks his blue Doctor-Grip pen angr Suddenly, Eric turns left, following a sign that says

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Taking the Key Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: What the hell for? We're not going to Georgetown.  145 146 147 148 89.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: They're doing construction on the Memorial. It was on the radio this morning.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: So take the Teddy Roosevelt.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm SSG; we tail people for a living. Key's faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sweep Team is working frantically to re-assemble the Plesac's cel-phone rings. He grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: GEDDES, (THRU CEL)
dialogues.text: He just bought you some time. They're heading for the Key.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: GEDDES
dialogues.text: I put 'em back at HQ in 30, 35 minutes. Is that enough?

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Not even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An FBI HELICOPTER hovers at a discreet altitude above GEORGETOWN, watching a single car. We Z00M DOWN TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRIDLOCK. A traffic jam. And the Suburban is dead center. ahead, a TOW-TRUCK is uncoupling TWO CARS.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanssen is livid.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Imbecile. Idiot!

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Is this what they teach you in “ghosting school?" No wonder the Bureau can never find anyone. Hanssen reaches across Eric and LEANS ON THE HORN.

dialogues.speaker: INT, FBI HQ
dialogues.text: Kate arrives, out of breath. She hurries over to Plesac.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I paged him. Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With every second, Hanssen's getting more irritated... un he simply grabs his bag and opens the car-door. That's ba

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sir, what're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: I can sit here for an hour. Or I can walk two blocks, get on the other side of that bottleneck by myself, and take a five minute cab-ride back to the office. Which do you think would better serve the needs of the Bureau? With that, he's gone, exiting the Chevy. And Eric is stuc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olsen, watching from up here, reaches for his cel-phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geddes instantly reaches for his cel-phone.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. FBI HQ
dialogues.text: Plesac's phone rings. He grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: Please tell me they're on their way to Niagara Falls.  91.

dialogues.speaker: GEDDES, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: Hanssen's on foot,

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: GEDDES
dialogues.text: I put him back at the office in 10 minutes, best case. Plesac snaps his phone shut with disgust, turns to Kate:

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Your boy is killing us.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric gets out of the Chevy, in the middle of this bumper- locked street, abandoning the truck to follow Hanssen. A few DRIVERS begin HONKING at him. Eric ignores them, heading for Hanssen, who walks angrily down the sidewalk:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Boss? (Hanssen keeps walking) You gotta get back in the truck, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Haven't you made enough mistakes for one day, Eric? Now you wanna throw in a traffic violation?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sir, you hafta get back in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Why should I?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: (no choice now) I lied to you, Sir. That stopped Hanssen in his tracks. He turns...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There isn't any construction on the Memorial Bridge. I made that up.  92. Another x-ray stare from Hanssen. Eric tries not to waver

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: it's Juliana; we've been fighting all morning.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: What about?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Your church. There it is - a big, fat lie... rooted in truth. And Hans despite himself, is hooked.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She didn't like it, Boss. It didn't... speak to her. So I wanted to go back to that Reading Room. I thought there might be some books I could get for her, to help her see things better. I thought you might tell me which ones to buy. A long beat, cars honking all around them now... And Eric can't tell if he's dead or not... until:

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Swear to God that everything you just told me is true.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sorry, Sir. I'm not gonna do that. (Hanssen waits) I don't lie about my wife. Or the church. If you don't know that yet then I sure as hell wouldn't take the name of the Lord in vain just to prove it to you. (silence...then:) Have a nice walk, Sir. I'll see you back at the office.  155 156 157 158 159
Eric turns, walks away. We STAY WITH HIM as he blows thro the middle of the street, passing pissed-off motorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plesac's cel-phone rings again.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric puts the key in the ignition, wondering how the hell he's going to explain all this... Then the passenger door opens. And Hanssen gets in.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: You're right. I overstepped. He sits heavily, eyes front, and pulls the door shut. INT. FBI HQ - GARAGE — SAME I57 Plesac's about to squeeze that cel-phone into pulp, when:

dialogues.speaker: GEDDES, (THRU CEL)
dialogues.text: O'Neill talked him back in. Plesac's eyes go wide. The news is too good to be trusted

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: How'd he manage that?

dialogues.speaker: GEDDES, (THRU CEL)
dialogues.text: Hard to say. But from here it looked like he may've proposed marriage.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: (turns to Kate:) Stay of execution. Kate half-smiles. END SEQUENCE... We CUT TO;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suburban pulls up to Hanssen's parking space... where Hanssen's silver Taurus sits, looking entirely unmolested

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric's silent. Books from the "Catholic Information Cente sit beside him. Hanssen eyes the Taurus, thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he pulls a BULKY MANILA ENVELOPE from his canvas bag Again, it's addressed to "Jack Hoschouer" in Bonn, German

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: This needs to be mailed.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You're not coming in, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: I_don't have to account to you, do I? That came out sharper than either had anticipated. Hansse hands him the envelope, then gets out. Eric pulls away. We STAY WITH HANSSEN, just a beat, as he examines his car before getting in. His face is unreadable... 160 INT. ERIC & JULIANA'S APT, — NIGHT 160 Eric sits at that crappy formica table, alone. A kettle i heating up on the stove. Another glass of Scotch awaits. Before him is that MANILA ENVELOPE, addressed to "Jack Hoschouer." Eric stares at it, conflicted. Then a SHRILL WHISTLE from the kettle pierces the silence startling him. Steam pours from its spout. Eric grabs the envelope, carries it to the stove...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on an unmarked VHS CASSETTE, with a Post-It attache “Jack, Think you'll like this one. Bob." It's not too late to stuff this tape back into its envelo (which sits beside the stove in the kitchen.) Instead Eri turns on his TV, and shoves in the cassette. First image on the screen shocks the hell out of him: It' the Hanssen bedroom, as seen from behind a DOOR of some k shot in Hi-8 video. Bonnie lies in bed, asleep... And a pit begins to form in Eric's gut. On the monitor, Hanssen crosses into frame, his mid-secti filling it entirely. He opens the door that's been blocki our view: (we now see that it was the door of their ARMOI Hanssen crosses to the bed, behind Bonnie, and peels back sheets. Bonnie's in a camisole.  162 95. He crawls in so that her body obscures our view of his, a begins to fondle her. We hear AUDIO now - her soft moans. Eric wants to look away, but can't. Hanssen tugs her panties down. Clearly, she doesn't know she's being taped. He pulls the camisole above her breast and frees himself from inside his Pajamas... ++-aS a sudden SOUND startles the hell out of Eric. And u It's the front door. Juliana just came home. She has GROC BAGS in her arms. Eric leaps for the VCR, hitting STOP just as she enters t room. He doesn't have time to turn the tv off... and does know if she caught the sound of moaning when she walked i

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: What're you watching?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Nothing. A training tape on surveillance. Hanssen asked me to check that the transfer was okay. Juliana bought that; (Thank God.) She heads for the kitch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets the bags down by the sink, right on top of that empty MANILA ENVELOPE addressed to Jack Hoschouer... ++.as Eric "casually* drifts out of the bedroom, dropping cassette into his gym bag.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How was school?

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: (unpacking items) It was fine. Would you mind getting the rest of the groceries for me?

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: Few more bags in the car. She tosses him the keys. He smiles, heads out. EXT. ALLEY BEHIND THEIR BLDG, — MOMENTS LATER 163 Eric emerges into the alley, disturbed as hell by what he just seen, but equally relieved that he won't have to exp it to Juliana. Then he freezes in his tracks. Just Saw something horribl Their Jeep. There aren't any grocery bags inside. And he just heard the sounds of BONNIE'S MOANING coming f his bedroom tv; (the room looks up into this alley.) He's dead, and he knows it. He races back toward: EXT. OUTSIDE THEIR BLDG. — TRACKING ERIC - CONTINUING 164 We're right on his back as he runs around the corner, crossing their thimble-sized lawn to a walkway. INT. THEIR BLDG. "LOBBY" — TRACKING ERIC - CONTINUING 165 He races into the building. Then down two steps, and into INT. ERIC & JULIANA'S APT, -— CONTINUING 166 He bursts in, breathless... Juliana is right where he expected her to be: sitting on edge of the bed... watching that tape. He hurries in.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Jule...

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Honey, it's not what you're--

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: She doesn't know she's being filmed, does she? Look at her, He hits STOP. And EJECT. She's still reeling... He throws tape and its envelope into his gym bag, zipping it shut,  97.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You shouldn't've opened this, Jule; it could've been Classified for all you knew.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: If it was Classified it wouldn't be sitting on our sink. Did he give it to you?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: Do you find it exciting?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: God, no.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: Is there a tape of us floating around out there somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: What?! Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: Then can you tell me why you have it? A long beat, his face working... until:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You know I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: Oh. "Needs of the Bureau," is that it? This is a case of some kind? She said that sarcastically... But he just tightened, wit meaning to. And that tells her something. ..-which means he'd better get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: (heads for the door) I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I'm not sure when I'll be back.  98.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: Is this what you want, Eric? That threw him. He stops at the door.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: This. Doing a job where lying to your wife is just business as usual. Is that who you want to be? That's a larger question than he was prepared for...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: This ds ass special circumstance.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about Hanssen. He's a creep, I knew that already. I'm talking about the Jife, (no reply) There's gotta be some other way you can serve your country where you wouldn't have to lie to me every day. Wouldn't that be better? Yes, it would be better - but he can't say so. In fact ri now he can't say much of anything, except:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I never said this was a case. Right? Juliana sags. She just gave up on him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIANA
dialogues.text: No. You didn't. They study one another, then he goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand raps hard on an apartment door, repeatedly. Then t door is opened by Kate. Eric stands in her doorway, too wound-up to say hello:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I think my wife just read herself into the case...  168 99. Kate throws a glare at Eric that is Hanssen-like in its disdain. Eric nearly staggers from it, Then she opens the door wider. He enters, INT. KATE'S APARTMENT — CONTINUING 168 It's a clean, efficient one-bedroom, looks like it's not very often. Kate closes the front door, calmly.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I'm assuming that you know what a massive fuck-up that would be.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Look, she's smart, okay? She puts things together.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You're as much to blame as anybody, ya know that? I'm telling so many lies now I can't keep 'em straight anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wanna make things easier? Next time Hanssen gives you a package and tells you to mail it, mail it! That made his jaw drop. Utter silence. She eyes him...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: How did you...?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That was a Bureau vehicle you were in today, Hot-Shot. It had ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Jesus. Agent Burroughs, I'm... It's what I came over to--

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The package has been re-sealed as you found it, right? No trace that it was ever opened, nothing that would arouse any suspicions on the other end?  100.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: No. I posted it from the Bureau five minutes ago. It was pristine,

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We'll see. There's nothing to say. He's beyond embarrassed now.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I understand that you're stressed, Eric. Cover-cases are like that. But Agents learn to withstand it; that's what makes them agents. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It was a--

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Just so happens, we don't think you'll have to withstand it much longer, maybe just days. Wait. That almost sounded encouraging. Eric pauses...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: What makes you think so?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We pulled 300 pages of classified materials out of a Lawn & Leaf Bag in his trunk today. His next drop appears to be imminent. Then he's ours. From despair to hope, just like that...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh. (a beat) I'm sorry you're having problems at home. I'd offer you some advice but it wouldn't be worth much - I don't even have a cat. Best I can tell you is keep your head on and do your job; it's your best shot at getting this over with. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Okay.  169 170 101. An awkward pause. There's not much to say...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should go. I'm sorry to've--

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It's fine. I'm supposed to be the one you bring problems to. He heads for the door. She escorts him, opens it. But he turns, just before leaving:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Is it worth it? (she's silent) Being an agent, what it costs. Is it worth it? She weighs that one for a second, then:

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Ask me when we've caught him. In the distance a few chords from a PIANO can be heard, t source unseen. The music carries us into: EXT. FOXSTONE PARK — DAY 169 Hanssen drives his car at 5 m.p.h., creeping past the entrance to Foxstone Park. He stares out the side window, looking for something... INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Agent named SKELTON gives a freshly-printed ARREST PLA one last proofread. (The document is twenty pages long.) peek over his shoulder as he flips through it. Paragraph SLUGLINES tell us what the Arrest Plan entails:

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER OF ARRESTING AGENTS, LEAD AGENT...
dialogues.text: Also: MEDICAL CONTINGENCIES, NEAREST MED-EVACS AND HOSPIT NEIGHBOR CONTROL, CROWD CONTROL, MEDIA CONTROL.  171 172 173 174

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That thing ready? We TILT UP... to find that 100 agents now cram this room: phones, computers, timelines, safes, maps. Kate sits oppo Skelton. He slides the Arrest Plan to her. The chords from that piano build, slowly. CONTINUE INTERC INT. FBI HQ - UNNAMED CORRIDOR — DAY 171 A_ corridor sits in yellowish light. More pallets of comp clog the hall. Behind us, ELEVATOR DOORS open. We CUED... ++-asS SPECIAL AGENT DEBRA SMITH emerges, carrying a PACK She's 35, African-American. We FOLLOW HER to: INT. FBI HQ - SIOC DOOR -— CONTINUING 172 This is the STOC that Eric and Hanssen once walked past: "Sensitive Compartmentalized Information Facility," "Restricted Access Area," "Authorized Personnel Only." Smith swipes her badge outside the door, enters a code...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanssen drives by the entrance to Foxstone Park again - j as slowly, but from the Opposite direction this time, hou later than his last Erap... «. Sted, looking for somethin ++-and still not seeing it. He drives off, As he does so, the CAR ALARM of a PARKED CAR HE JUST DROV PAST begins to wail. Hanssen notes it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside Skelton's Arrest Plan is an OPERATIONAL PLAN. Its sluglines read: REMOVAL OF SUSPECT'S VEHICLE, NOTIFICATIO SUSPECT'S FAMILY, CHAIN OF COMMAND AT COMMAND POST. It's now Plesac who is looking the documents over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the office of an ASAC (Asst. Special Agt. in Char Plesac enters, hands Skelton's arrest plan to the ASAC,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUING 176
dialogues.text: The ASAC carries Skelton's plan to the office of an S.A.C (Special Agent in Charge). We return to FBI HQ:  177 179 180 182 183 184

INTERCUT WITH/INT. FBI HQ - INSIDE THE sioc - SAME 177 A windowless, trapezoidal space built for three. But 12 PEOPLE are in here, surrounded by maps, computers, timeli safes. Special Agent Smith enters, bearing that package. ++-which we now recognize as the Arrest & Operational Pla Now it must go up the chain here at Headquarters. Smith h it to an Agent named PACK. Music continues, as:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUING 178
dialogues.text: Pack enters, handing the Plan to Mike Rochford. INT. FBI HQ — BEREZNAY'S OFFICE - MONTAGE CONTINUING L79 Rochford hands the Plan to Bereznay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bereznay enters, carrying the Arrest Plan. DEPUTY ASST. D KEN WAGUESPACK and ASST. DIR. NEIL GALLAGHER wait for it. INT. FBI HQ - FREEH'S OFFICE — MONTAGE CONTINUING 181 Gallagher and Waguespack enter an office. The NAMEPLATE outside it reads: "Louis Freeh — Director." And we see LO FREEH himself, awaiting the Arrest PLAN.» «: A door shuts. We're outside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanssen creeps by the park again, shining a FLASHLIGHT ou his window... At last, he sees what he's been looking for A piece of WHITE TAPE, affixed to the ENTRY SIGN of the p Hanssen notes it, then drives off. As he does, he passes ANOTHER PARKED CAR. The ALARM on this one begins to wail

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. AMERICAN UNIV.
dialogues.text: It's JULIANA'S PIANO-PLAYING we've been hearing. She hits final note. END MUSIC. END INTERCUT. END MONTAGE. And we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric sits at his desk, trying to keep it together... A document sits before him: "MISSION STATEMENT for the 1 Information Assurance Division... by Robert P. Hanssen."  185 104. pages long. Across its top is a hand-written note: "Pleas check this for spelling and typographical errors, R.H." Eric eyes it. THAT MUSIC CONTINUES, but it has receded in the background now. All is quiet, until:

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Eric? Hanssen's voice, coming from behind a closed door.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Yes Boss?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come in here. I want to show you something. Eric rises, heads toward Hanssen's office. INT. FBI HQ - ROOM 9930 — HANSSEN'S OFFICE - CONTINUING 1 Eric enters. Hanssen is at his desk, staring at a LAPTOP, hands hidden from us. Music recedes even farther now...

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know this movie? Eric crosses to the desk... where he finds Entrapment, starring Catherine Zeta-Jones, playing on Hanssen's lapto ++.and Robert Hanssen, touching himself over his pants, obviously aroused.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's very appealing. Eric pauses, no idea how to play this one. Hanssen contin to touch himself, then looks to Eric for a response.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir. I've always thought so.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: This is the address of my mechanic in Manassas. I'm dropping my car off in the morning. Need you to pick me up and bring me into work. As if all was perfectly normal, he nods toward a slip of paper that sits on the edge of his desk. Eric takes it.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Close the door on your way out. INT. 9930 - ERIC'S OFFICE — CONTINUING 186 Eric shuts the door, pauses. Christ, that was creepy. Just then his PAGER goes off again. He eyes it: T#. INT. WFO - CONFERENCE ROOM — EVENING 187 Eric enters the packed room, breathless. He ran here. Oddly, there's no buzz in here tonight. The faces look strained. He spots Kate, in that same cubicle. He heads o INT. WFO - CONFERENCE ROOM — CUBICLE - CONTINUING 188 Kate sits, looking pretty gloomy. Eric hurries in.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: This guy is melting down. He just-~ Then Eric stops - just noticed the look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I was wrong, Eric. We're hot days away from getting this guy. (Eric waits) Son of a bitch is going to ground. Eric is silent. Before Kate is a single page, a typed LET

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just got the encryption off this one: his last letter to his handlers in the SVR, dated ten days ago. Eric doesn't reach for it. She begins to read it aloud:

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Dear Friends..."

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. HANSSEN HOME
dialogues.text: Hanssen eyes his laptop. On the screen is a letter. It be with the words, “Dear Friends..." We hear Kate, in V.0. n  190

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D, V.O.)
dialogues.text: "I thank you for your assistance these many years. It seems, however, that my greatest utility to you has come to an end, and it is time to seclude myself from active service." INT. WFO - CONFERENCE ROOM -— RESUMING 190 That was a bomb; we can see it on Eric's face...

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. ST. CATHERINE'S
dialogues.text: Hanssen enters this magnificent church.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.0., CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Since communicating last, and one wonders if because of it, I have been promoted to a higher do-nothing Senior Executive job, outside of regular access to information within the counterintelligence program." Hanssen dips his finger in the water, crosses himself, as VOICE begins to over-ride Kate's, also in V.0O.:

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "It is as if I am being isolated..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels at a pew and begins to pray.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (V.0O., CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Furthermore, I believe I have detected repeated bursting radio signal emanations from my vehicle. I have not found their source, but as you wisely do, I will leave this aione, for knowledge of their existence is sufficient."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on his face, as he types out the words:

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (V.O., CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Amusing the games children play." 194

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanssen has been at prayer for a while now. We MOVE IN TI  195 196 197 198 107.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (V.O., CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “In this, however, I strongly suspect that you should have concerns for the integrity of your compartment concerning knowledge of my efforts on your behalf." A single tear rolls down his cheek. He rises, sniffs back tear. We linger on the empty pew as he exits frame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanssen opens the TRUNK of his Taurus. Inside we find tha LAWN & LEAF BAG, sealed,

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (V.0O., CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Something has aroused the sleeping tiger. Perhaps you know better than Ee" He removes the lawn & leaf bag from the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate comes to the end of the letter... EXT. ERIC & JULIANA'S APARTMENT — NIGHT 197 Hanssen's Taurus pulls up to the curb outside Eric & Juliana's building. He eyes the front door...

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: “Life is full of its ups and downs..." Hanssen cuts his engine. END INTERCUT. We DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pizza boxes sit on the floor. Kate sits with Skelton, Sargent, Sherin, and Lopez. Eric is here, but he seems somehow just outside the circle.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay. If he doesn't make another drop, what do we have?

dialogues.speaker: SKELTON
dialogues.text: We've got the Palm Pilot. That still gives us Conspiracy to Commit Espionage.  108.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: ++-until he walks into court with a lawyer who says that everything on the Palm Pilot was just notes for a Spy novel he was planning to write,

dialogues.speaker: SHERIN
dialogues.text: We've got the evidence from his trunk, Unauthorized Possession of Classified Material.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That's five years -— hardly enough to make him talk.

dialogues.speaker: LOPEZ
dialogues.text: Maybe we just keep promoting him. (they turn) Might be the only way to keep him from retiring. They're just pissed off enough to find that funny.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIN
dialogues.text: Great. We make him Deputy Assistant in Charge of Parks and Footbridges. Some bitter laughs go around. Gallows humor...

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: Section Chief, Lawn & Leaf Bag Division.

dialogues.speaker: SKELTON
dialogues.text: Director, Pornography Crash Unit.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Christ, if he plays his cards right he might wind up running the whole Bureau. They laugh; it's funny... until it stops being funny. And laughter stops. -..Jjust as PLESAC ENTERS, urgently, with news:

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: He's outside your apartment. (Eric turns) He's parked outside your apartment. Just pulled up.  199 200 109. That stops things cold in here. But before Eric can react his CELL-PHONE rings. He eyes the incoming number, then looks to Plesac:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: It's Hanssen,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIRES SQUEAL as a FORD EXPLORER pulls away from the wWFro INT. PLESAC'S TRUCK - MOVING -— LATER (NIGHT) 200 Plesac drives, racing - Kate beside him. Eric sits in bac anxiously eyeing his watch.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: How drunk?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I don't know, he wasn't slurring or anything. Where're you dropping me off? I don't want him to--

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: The ghosts said he's been driving all over the place tonight. came to your apartment after sitting in his church for an hour.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sounded surlier than usual, but that's it. Plesac blows through a RED LIGHT. Kate checks the clock.. KATE ; I'd be a lot happier if he didn't have an armory in his trunk...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Drop me off here, okay? My apartment's right around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: I know where it is. Plesac pulls over at:  201 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric gets out on 8th Street. A passing CAR splashes into deep POTHOLE, sending slush toward us. He pauses, thinkin ++-then leans in to Kate's window. Just decided something

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You've got a team on his tail, right?

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Pull ‘em back. A beat. Plesac thinks he might've heard that wrong...

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Why would I wanna do that?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I think I can still work him, Sir. I think I can get him comfortable enough to make that drop.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Have you been listening the last few hours? There is no drop. He's going to ground. He said so in the letter.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: The letter is why he still has to make the drop. Plesac doesn't understand. Neither does Kate.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He wrote it ten days ago. And he doesn't use e-mail with these guys. That means it hasn't been sent yet. If he doesn't make another drop, he'd be disappearing on them without explaining why. He'd never do that.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: They make him feel too important. Not a bad point. Kate looks to Plesac.  202 T1i.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. I can handle him — but not if he picks up a tail.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: What if he's made you?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: What if he has? Bumper-locking him won't make me any safer, (a beat) The guy's got his antennas up, Sir. Again, Kate looks to Plesac. Eric awaits a decision... un

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: Okay. We pull back. With that, Plesac pulls into traffic, reaching for his ce phone. Kate throws one last look at Eric, then they're go Eric watches them go, then approaches the corner of 8th & We TRACK HIM on his way. He turns the corner... ++-and spots Hanssen's Taurus, parked 100 feet away, righ outside the apartment. Eric pauses, readying himself.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: (to no one) Get on the boat, do your job, and get back home again... With that, he approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty bottle of Gin sits by Hanssen's side. an "Andrew Sisters" song plays on his stereo. Hanssen stares, until:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Boss. Hanssen turns sleepily, as Eric leans in the open window.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Five minutes, as promised. Caught me coming right out of the Metro.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Why didn't you drive? That sounded drunk. And angry.  203 204 205 112.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Juliana needed the car. I felt like walking anyway.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Why? Something on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Not especially.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Get in. I want some company. Eric pauses... asa non-descript SEDAN pulls by them. Gedd is_driving it. The sedan vanishes. Eric is on his own now

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sure. Eric opens the door, climbs in. we do too. INT. HANSSEN'S CAR - PARKED — CONTINUING 203 Eric looks Hanssen over, searching for a weapon: in Hanss jacket? Inside that ankle holster?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where're we--

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Can I trust you? Eric freezes. That was so stark, so direct...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Of course... Don't you know that?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: I don't know what I know anymore, Then Hanssen hits the gas. We move OUTSIDE ERIC'S WINDOW the Taurus pulls away. Looks like we're going for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: LATER NIGHT 204
dialogues.text: The Taurus glides by us, against the backdrop of ROCK CRE PARK. It's huge, vast... and dark.

dialogues.speaker: SAME 205
dialogues.text: Another Andrews Sisters song plays. Hanssen taps a finger it, definitely drunk, and looks over his shoulder, out th back window. They've been silent for ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: It is against Bureau policy for an Agent to consume alcohol. Ever. Even off-duty... because an FBI Agent is hever off-duty. That's Director Freeh's "BrightLine Policy."

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your car?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Why. Ya hear something?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: No. You asked me to meet you at your mechanic in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm having it Swept. For electronic devices. Eric shrugs. Hanssen checks his rear-view mirror now.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've been sensing signal bursts coming through the radio lately. And car alarms go off when I drive past. (Eric nods) It's not beneath the Russians to track me. I'm tailed all the time. They know how much I know. Then, without warning, Hanssen turns left, from the middl dane, into Rock Creek Park. That feels ominous.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: We goin' to the park?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: It's a clear night. Eric's CEL-PHONE RINGS. Hanssen glares at the sound. Eric silences it quickly. They drive on,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drive in darkness, a frozen creek and THICK WOODS arou us. Eric looks around, trying to guess what's coming...

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had eggs for breakfast this morning, I'm behind on my tithing to the church, I own eighteen guns.  114.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: My list. Thought we might see if you'd learned enough to catch me.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Should I go on? (Exic nods...) Last night Victor Sheymov offered me a job with Invicta. Two-hundred—and— fifty-thousand a year, starting immediately. When I was a kid my father liked to leave me bound on our Living Room floor until I wet my pants... And I don't believe anything actually happened to your mother the night Bonnie and I came over. I think you were somewhere else and just didn't want to tell me. That was a mouthful. Eric pauses, assessing it all as roa rolls under them. Awfully dark out here.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Y'ever notice how often you try to catch me in a lie, Boss?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: I wonder why that is.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Maybe you've spent so many years studying spooks you can't imagine anybody telling the truth. (Hanssen doesn't react) Jule and I have an Anniversary coming up. That night I was out arranging a surprise for her. I made up the mom thing so she wouldn't know. A beat. No idea if that flew or not...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry about your father.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Maybe that's the part I made up.  207 208 115.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Hanssen breathes out a bitter laugh, then pulls the car o at a secluded spot.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What're we doing?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Agent-training. That's what you wanted, right? And he gets out, waiting for Eric to follow. Eric does so EXT. ROCK CREEK PARK — ROAD — CONTINUING 207 Hanssen crosses the road, toward a small CLEARING by the creek. Eric follows. Cold enough to see your breath out h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad place to dump a body, (Chandra Levy will be fou here in less than a year.) Eric follows Hanssen, twigs an snow crackling under their feet. Otherwise, there's SILEN ++-until Hanssen stops, and pulls his .38 from a holster.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They test you at 25 yards, 15 yards, seven yards, and five yards, With that, he aims at a branch and FIRES, a deafening sou (Eric is beside him.) The branch is decimated.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Prone, left hand, right hand, five- yards-with-gun-in-holster. You get three seconds to fire five shots. He turns and FIRES AGAIN, blowing away another branch. Bu this time the gun is just a foot from Eric's face. Eric d to his knees out of instinct.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: FBI's a gun-culture, I told you. Can't advance here unless you can shoot.  116. He extends a hand. Eric rises... Then BANG! Another blast mere INCHES from Eric's face this time. Eric spins away.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: What're you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Who was calling you before?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: What?! Hanssen steps toward him, then another SHOT, right beside Eric's ear now. Eric spins away again, scared witless.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: I need to know if I can trust you.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Put the gun down, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: (another shot) Who was on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: I NEED TO KNOW IF I CAN TRUST YOU
dialogues.text: Hanssen's fires again, but... CLICK. His .38 is empty. There's a surprised silence for a moment. Then Eric knocks the gun from his hand. It falls into sno

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Can I trust you? Jesus! Hanssen doesn't answer... and Eric finally erupts:

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ya know something, Boss? You do test people too much, and I've had it! Who the hell d'you think was calling me? My handlers in the Kremlin? Once and for all, for the record: I don't have any. I'm not a foreign agent! Is that official enough? ‘Cause I'm getting really tired of having to prove myself to you every five minutes. And by the way, if I were SVR don't you think I'd be working my way through (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Intel by now, instead of wasting my time in some do-nothing I.T. Division? Look around you, Boss: it's just us out here. There's no one tailing you, there isn't any GPS on your car. You don't matter that much. There it was - the perfect dodge, a lie that is 100% true And Hanssen doesn't know what to do with dbs 5

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The call was from Juliana, obviously. My wife. She's trying to reach me because I told her I'd be home by now and because we're in another fight, caused by you as usual. Thanks for dropping by unannounced and lecturing her about Opus Dei, that was real helpful. And thanks for staring at her in church like she was from Mars. That also worked out great. Lemme guess, you were testing her too. Ya know she asked me this morning why you're like this, why you grind everybody so hard. And I had all these answers ready: "He's misunderstood." "He's trying to fix the Bureau and no one'll listen." "He was born in the wrong century." "His father was a prick." I've got a whole list. But ya know something? At the end of the day it's all crap. You are who you are and you do what you do. The why doesn't mean a fucking thing. Does it? Hanssen considers that, his face a blank... +..then he turns without a word, and starts a slow, drunk walk back toward the car. Conversation over.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: I matter plenty. He vanishes into a thicket of woods. We hear his shoulder rubbing against the brush... Eric doesn't move. He can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric watches as the Taurus pulls away, disappearing into night. He pulls out his cel-phone, dials.  210 211 212 213 214 118. INTERCUT WITH/INT. WFO - 5TH FLOOR CONF. ROOM -— SAME 210 Huge buzz in here again. Kate's cel rings.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: Yes, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: Get the tail back on him - but discreet. He's definitely making another drop. Tomorrow, maybe even tonight.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: You're not burnt?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: No. I'm not burnt.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (INTO CEL)
dialogues.text: Okay. We're on him. Nice work, Eric. He's about to say thanks, but she's already hung up. END INTERCUT. We remain with Eric... then DISSOLVE TO: INT./EXT. HANSSEN'S CAR — PARKED - DAY (4 P.M.) 211 Hanssen, sitting in his Taurus, parked at a curb on Fairw Drive in Vienna, Va. We DRIFT IN toward him, a slow zoom, he stares out the window, at the trees. Hard to say exactly what he's thinking just now, but ther a certain resignation on his face, a yielding to somethin inevitable. We land on a CLOSE-UP. He sighs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits, staring at a VIDEO MONITOR. On it, she's picki up a LIVE FEED from inside a vehicle of some kind. Looks the vehicle is parked in a mall. Eric enters, urgently. He sits, looks to the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanssen gets out, opens the trunk... That sealed LAWN & L BAG awaits, beside CHALK and TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawn & Leaf bag in hand, he crosses Fairway Drive as it slopes toward a large PARK. A wooden SIGN marks its entra "Foxstone Park." He passes the sign and enters.  215 216 217 218 119. INTERCUT WITH/INT. FBI HQ - SIOC — SAME 215 Bereznay is on the phone;

dialogues.speaker: BEREZNAY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I don't want anything disruptive at the arrest site. We don't wanna scare off whoever's picking up the package. He hangs up, eyes his team, gives them the news:

dialogues.speaker: BEREZNAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's operational. How many of the Russian I.0.'s are unaccounted for? EXT. FOXSTONE PARK - FOOTBRIDGE — MOMENTS LATER 216 Through bare trees we see the houses that overlook this p Hanssen, standing at a tiny FOOTBRIDGE, eyes the houses. he sighs. Then he climbs UNDER the footbridge, stows that lawn & leaf bag there... and walks away. EXT. FOXSTONE PARK -— TRAIL — CONTINUING 217

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanssen walks on a thin trail, footbridge at his back. So feel oddly amplified out here: his footsteps, his breaths the buzzing of a bird. We're CLOSE on his face... He stops at that park-entrance sign, takes a piece of COL CHALK from his pocket, and draws a single line on the par sign. Then he pockets the chalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up the incline from the park entrance to his car Fairway Drive is quiet and calm. . ++-until he hears a SHARP SOUND, to his right: a VAN DOOR sliding open quickly. He turns. ++.aS FIVE SWAT GUYS explode out of a WHITE VAN, bearing MACHINE GUNS. Then he hears the SQUEALING OF BRAKES... and a SECOND VAN appears, out of nowhere, followed by a white Ford Excursi His head swivels... A total of TWELVE AGENTS, armed to th teeth, now close in on him. He freezes,

dialogues.speaker: SWAT AGENT
dialogues.text: You're under arrest! Put your hands in the air!  219 120. INTERCUT WITH/INT. WFO. — KATE'S CUBICLE - RESUMING That video monitor, we now realize, is picking up the fee from inside the Excursion at the arrest site. So Eric is watching all this live, without sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a blur, Hanssen is Surrounded. SWAT AGENT #2, his weap inches from Hanssen's face, grabs Hanssen's car keys.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: The guns won't be necessary. The guns won't be necessary. He's cuffed and led to the Excursion... where Plesac awai Hanssen pauses in front of him, almost smiling.

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe now you'll listen.

dialogues.speaker: PLESAC
dialogues.text: It's a sad day for all of us, Bob. Hanssen is shoved into the Excursion. The others pile in. Excursion pulls away, followed by the white vans. An agen jumps into Hanssen's Taurus and drives it away as well. INT. WFO. - KATE'S CUBICLE -— RESUMING Eric watches. The whole thing makes him want to cry, thou he's not entirely sure why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++-and Fairway Drive is Fairway Drive again - no sign tha anything out of the ordinary has occurred. We DISSOLVE TO ++-Exic, carrying a CARDBOARD BOX of his belongings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. FBI HQ - ROOM 9930 - pay 219 He's here to clean out his stuff. Juliana is by his side. looks the room over with some reverence, knowing now what husband was put through in here.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: We should go. She nods. Eric turns to the door... then he STOPS:  220 221 222 121.5 On a cabinet is one of those fat blue Doctor-Grip Pens. E breathes out a smile, puts the pen in his box... INT. FBI HQ - OUTSIDE ROOM 9930 — DAY 220 Box in hand, he shuts the door to 9930 for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric leads Juliana down another nameless hallway, past a GLASS CASE boasting a display of the FBI's HISTORIC ARRES Beside it is a FLIER notifying us of a retirement party t honor a SECRETARY's 35 years of service. Cake and cookies They turn a corner, heading for a bank of elevators. INT. FBI HQ - BANK OF ELEVATORS — CONTINUING 222) Ten feet away, a pair of elevator doors begin to close. Eric hurries over, knifing his free hand between the clos doors. They open... And he freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Oh. Robert Hanssen, master-spy, is inside the elevator, flank by Kate and Plesac. His hands are cuffed. Eric stands stiffly, no idea what to say. The moment hang Juliana appears at his side, equally thrown. Hanssen eyes his would-be protege, half-smiles at Juliana Then he utters the last words they'll ever hear from him:

dialogues.speaker: HANSSEN
dialogues.text: Pray for me? Eric's jaw nearly drops. He backs away, allowing the elev doors to close. Juliana's silent. As the doors come together, we MOVE IN ON HANSSEN... +.-and an odd thing happens: the light above him begins t dim. Then it starts to vanish entirely. He looks up, confused, wondering how in the world everyth suddenly got so dark. Then the doors meet one another, an Hanssen is in utter blackness. We leave him there, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DARK SCREEN. Then a CRAWL appears, in stages: “Under the threat of the Death Penalty, Robert Hanssen submitted to extensive questioning by FBI interrogators." "In return, Hanssen was given a life sentence. He's now incarcerated in the Supermax Federal Penitentiary in Florence, Colorado where he spends 23 hours per day in solitary confinement." "Hanssen revealed the names of at least fifty human sourc to his Russian handlers. Three are known to have been executed. Scores more were imprisoned by the KGB. Many of them remain so today." “Eric O'Neill left the Bureau in 2001. He and Juliana rem in D.C., where Eric now practices law."
